fields.description:
h3. Summary
The _Main Header_ (the one with the breadcrumbs and action buttons) stays in front of the text when coming from a link that is below in the page.

For example, if we have an anchor in the middle of the page, then at the bottom of the page we have a link to that anchor, as soon as we click on that anchor link the page will scroll up to that anchor. Along with that automatic scrolling, the _main header_ will stay in front of the content.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page with content
# Add the Anchor macro in the middle of the page
# Now keep adding content until you can't see the anchor without scrolling up
# Add a link to the created anchor
# Save the page
# Access the page, scroll down to the word with the link to the anchor and click on it

h3. Expected Results
* The page will scroll up and you'll see the content.

h3. Actual Results
* The page will scroll up but the main header will stay in front of the anchored content.
 
h3. Notes
* This also happens if you use the TOC macro. But of course it needs to be at the end of the page since the main header only shows when scrolling up in the page.

h3.Workaround
* Scroll up so that you can see the content, then scroll down again if necessary.
fields.summary: Main Header Overlays Anchored Content

fields.description:
Steps to replicate :
1. Create a page "Actors", add "page-property-report-macro" for label "req-actor" for "current space" with filter " With ancestor: current page"
2. Create a subpage (of "Actors") "System" with label "req-actor", "page-property-macro" with fields "name" and "description"
3. Create a subpage (of "Actors") "User" with label "req-actor", "page-property-macro" with fields "name" and "description"
4. Open page "Actors" and see two entries in the page-property-report-macro-list
5. Create a new page "Actors and Stuff" on the same level as "Actors"
6. Include "Actors" using the page-include-macro
7. View page "Actors and Stuff"
8. Actors-Table is empty, but list with "System" and "User" is expected as it is shown at page "Actors"
9. Goto page "Actors" and remove filter "With ancestor" in page-property-report-macro
10. Goto page "Actors and Stuff" and see the table is now shown as expected

*Current Behavior* : The include page does not show the list of pages
*Expected Behavior* : The include page should show the list of pages
fields.summary: Page property report macro "with ancestor" filter not working as expected

fields.description:
As a Confluence editor, I would like to be able to switch to the the JIRA Service Desk "Knowledge Base" view because my customers like well-formatted documentation.

 

A JSD customer is able to see Confluence pages as a Knowledge Base pages.  However, these KB pages are narrower than the standard view.  I would like to be able to switch between the views from the page.  This will make editing the page for customers easier.
fields.summary: Switch from Confluence User view to  "Knowledge Base" view

fields.description:
h3. Issue

When editing macros that use a modal window (or redirect to an external service), if multiple users edit the macro at the same time, changes are not updated live, and whoever saves the macro last will overwrite the changes of the previous person.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Run Confluence with Collaborative Editing enabled
# Create a page and insert a macro such as _Roadmap Planner_.
# Save the page
# Edit the page, and click on the macro and select 'Edit'.
# In another browser/private browsing window, log in with a different user and edit the same page/macro
# In window #1, make a change to the macro, but do not click 'Insert'
# In window #2, make a different change.  Click 'Insert'
# Back in window #1, click 'Insert'

At this point, only the change made in window #1 will be visible.  The change in window #2 is gone.

h3. Expected/Suggested Behavior

Update the changes in modal windows as well.  If that cannot be done, then display a warning on the window that any changes made here could potentially be overwritten by someone else who is editing at the same time.
fields.summary: Collaborative editing does not work in some macros

fields.description:
Our company is a customer of
Atlassian in terms of Confluence. Among other things we are using
Confluence for linking word documents which are stored on our local server.
We want the work documents to be directly accessible via a
file:///-Links-connection.

When linking several documents on one Confluence page the problem is that
this can only be done within one session. It is not possible to add a link
to another document in a later session. In that case the previous links on
the respective page do not work any longer and disappear. It is very time
consuming for us to rebuild the page again with all the linkages.

Enclosed you find a screenshot of how the links shall look like. We didn't
have that problem two months ago and would be thankful for a quick and
sustainable solution.

In case of questions or further clarication of the problem please do not
hesitate to contact us.

Kind regards,

Jörg
fields.summary: When linking several documents on one Confluence page the problem is that this can only be done within one session

fields.description:
h3. Issue

Running Synchrony as a stand-alone service for data center instances exposes sensitive information such as the database username/password, and public/private keys. These are all passed as JVM arguments. This means anyone with command-line access to the server can see this information via a {{ps}} command.  
h3. To Reproduce
 # Set up Synchrony as a stand-alone service
 # Start Synchrony
 # Run {{ps -ef | grep synchrony}}
 # Results:

{code:java}
synchro+  1707     1 89 18:19 ?        00:00:08 java -Xms2048k -Xmx1024m -classpath /opt/atlassian/synchrony/synchrony-standalone.jar:/opt/atlassian/synchrony/postgresql-42.1.1.jar -Dsynchrony.cluster.impl=hazelcast-btf -Dsynchrony.port=8091 -Dcluster.listen.port=5701 -Dsynchrony.cluster.base.port=25500 -Dcluster.join.type=tcpip -Dcluster.join.tcpip.members=192.168.56.1 -Dsynchrony.context.path=/synchrony -Dsynchrony.cluster.bind=192.168.56.102 -Dsynchrony.bind=192.168.56.102 -Dcluster.interfaces=192.168.56.102 -Dsynchrony.service.url=http://192.168.56.102:8091/synchrony -Dreza.service.url=http://192.168.56.102:8091/synchrony -Djwt.private.key=<PRIVATE_KEY_HERE> -Djwt.public.key=<PUBLIC_KEY_HERE> Dsynchrony.database.url=jdbc:postgresql://10.0.2.2:5432/confluence631 -Dsynchrony.database.username=<DATABASE_USERNAME_HERE> -Dsynchrony.database.password=<DATABASE_PASSWORD_HERE> -Djava.net.preferIPv4Stack=true -Dip.whitelist=192.168.56.1,localhost synchrony.core sql
jason     1728  1674  0 18:19 pts/0    00:00:00 grep --color=auto synchrony{code}
h3. Suggestion

Make Synchrony read this information from a file that can be locked to only be readable by the user running Synchrony.  This could be a copy of {{confluence.cfg.xml}} or a new file.
h3. Workaround

Prevent unnecessary users from having shell access to the box on which Synchrony is running; i.e. deny logon by disabling or removing unneeded users from the synchrony system. Also, for Linux systems running a kernel version newer than 3.3 you can mount /proc with hidepid=1 or 2, more information on doing this can be found at [https://www.cyberciti.biz/faq/linux-hide-processes-from-other-users/] .
fields.summary: Move sensitive information out of Synchrony JVM arguments

fields.description:
Given that font awesome icons are used a lot in web based software, being able to natively use these icons in confluence would be a great improvement to the current functionality.

In #39365 a corresponding issue "being able to create custom icons" had been closed referring the author to a workaround with an add-on that allowed using font awesome in confluence. (Font Awesome Icons for Confluence by Argonio ltd.) This add-on still does not support Confluence 6 and the workaround therefore is not feasible. A user had asked whether this add-on would support confluence 6 at some point in december 2016 and never received an answer.

A second similar add-on (Awesome Icons by Rumpelcoders) only supports Confluence Server.

Aside from that, being able to create custom icons and using a predefined font that includes icons are different issues. I therefore created this as a separate suggestion. PNGs of the needed icons can not be used inline in the way font awesome icons could.
fields.summary: Allow adding font awesome font or provide native support of fa icons to Confluence 6

fields.description:
h2. *How to reproduce this problem*

Have Confluence 6.2.3 + JIRA 7.3.8 installed and configured with application links:
 # Create a dashboard in JIRA
 # Click Add Gadget, then Manage gadgets to add the Activity Stream Gadget with the gadget URL served from confluence
 # Add the *Activity Stream Gadget* to a JIRA dashboard, and observe the error message about resource cannot be found.

The issue could be reproduced by adding the Activity Stream gadget into a page in confluence.
h2. *Diagnosis*

Within *Jira*:
 # Navigate to *Jira Administration* » *System* » *Logging and profiling*
 ** Enable *HTTP Access logging*

Within *Confluence*:
 # Add the *Activity Stream Gadget* to a JIRA dashboard, and observe the error message about resource cannot be found.

On *Jira side*:
 # Open up {{$JIRA_HOME/log/atlassian-jira-http-access.log}}
 # Search for *{{rest/webResources/1.0/resources}}*
{code:java|title=atlassian-jira-http-access.log}
127.0.0.1 i843x1060x1 admin [02/Nov/2017:14:03:22 +1100] "POST http://localhost:8080/jira/jira/rest/webResources/1.0/resources HTTP/1.1" - - - "http://localhost:8751/jira/plugins/servlet/gadgets/ifr?container=atlassian&mi...
127.0.0.1 o843x1060x1 admin [02/Nov/2017:14:03:22 +1100] "POST http://localhost:8080/jira/jira/rest/webResources/1.0/resources HTTP/1.1" 404 0 0.0010 "http://localhost:8751/jira/plugins/servlet/gadgets/ifr?container=atlas...
{code}
 # You can see that the URL requested into Jira by confluence has the Jira web context "*/jira*" incorrectly added twice resulting in a *HTTP 404 Not Found Error*

h2. *Cause*

Confluence is incorrectly doubling up the Jira web context path when hitting the Jira *{{rest/webResources/1.0/resources}}* REST call.

h2. *Workaround*

Some people are able to work around the issue by creating a redirect rule as follows:

Pattern: \bconfluence/(\bconfluence.*) 
Rewrite URL: http://localhost:8090/\{R:1}

Essentially chopping off the second /confluence.
NOTE: You must move this rule above the rewrite rule that sends normal traffic to confluence.

The same for double jira.
fields.summary: Activity Stream gadget throws "The resource rest/webResources/1.0/resources, cannot be found." error

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Macros from different add-ons but with the same macro name override the other, making it unusable.

h3. Environment
* Tested in Confluence 5.10.7 
* Tested in Confluence 6.1.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install Bob swift - Markdown for Confluence addon.
# Install Adaptavist script runner addon for confluence.
# Create a page, try to use Bob swift - Markdown macro, but Confluence will select Adaptavist's markdown macro.
# Try disabling the Adaptavist's markdown macro here <confluence-server-url>/plugins/servlet/scriptrunner/builtin?section=confluence_macros
# Still confluence is not able to select Bob swift - Markdown macro, rather tries to search Adaptavist markdown macro and throws an exception.
# Now disable both Markdown macros and enable Bob swift - Markdown macro only. Now Confluence able to select Bob swift - Markdown macro.

h3. Expected Results
The selected macro will be used

h3. Actual Results
Only one macro is being used even if the other one with the same name is selected

h3. Notes
Steps 4 and 5 does not happen in version 5.10.7 but can be replicated in 6.1.1
fields.summary: Confluence not honouring the selected macro when macros from different addons have same macro Name

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The Agile Wallboard Gadget will spin and fail to load if more than 1 quick filter is used.  If 1 or no quick filters are chosen, then it loads fine.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Set up the Agile Wallboard Gadget in Confluence 
# Add it to a page, and choose multiple quick filters
# Save the page and try to load it.  

h3. Expected behaviour
The gadget should display the data correctly. 

h3. Current behaviour 
The gadget will display the loading animation, but never load

h3. Workaround solution.
# Edit the gadget, and choose only 1 quick filter
# Save the page and load it.  It loads fine.
fields.summary: Agile Wallboard Gadget breaks in Confluence with more than 1 quick filter

fields.description:
I did search but did not find anything similar. Forgive me, if I have overseen something.

 

User, rights, and group administration would become more comfortable if groups could consist of, not only users, but groups as well.

 

As for one possible example:

You could create a group "Department" and it would consist of

the manager, maybe also his superior, and the team groups.

 

You cold then easily use the department group to define global an space settings.

And you could link team groups to specific pages and structures within the space.

Whenever personnel changes occur you would avoid to have to look over several groups.
fields.summary: Allow groups, not only users, as part of groups

fields.description:
h3. Description
Currently, confluence does not have the feature to add a user to another group than the confluence-users group when creating a new user. This causes new user is not receiving an email if the confluence admin removed the confluence-users group from the global permission page.

h3. Suggestion
Allow admin to specific newly created user to join which group by default when creating a new user.
fields.summary: Allow admin to specific the group member ship when creating a new user

fields.description:
Hi,

We recently got an upgrade to Confluence 6.2.4 at a client I help with Java EE.

And was irritated to see the "Save" button suddenly changed its German translation from "Speichern" to "Aktualisieren". "Save and Notify" still called "Speichern und Benachrichtigen".

That not only is inconsistent, it's just wrong, because "Aktualisieren" stands for "Refresh" or "Update" in the sense of showing updates by others.

Can this be changed to its original translation again, please?
fields.summary: Poor German translation for "Save"

fields.description:
In addition to CONFSERVER-38287 I would like suggest further improvements to the Task Report Macro.
 * It should be possible to restrict the listed tasks to current page (without knowing the name/id of the current page, useful for templates)
 * It should be possible to list the tasks of a given page tree (current/given page and all child pages)
 * It should be possible to list both completed and incomplete tasks at the same time
 * The huge banner which is shown for an empty task list should be optional (or removed)
 * The location link should point directly to the task position not just to the page. (would require an automaic anchor for tasks)
fields.summary: Enhance Task Report Macro

it is really important please support exporting Arabic files asap.

fields.description:
This error occurs under the following scenario: # Position the cursor at the end of a heading line and insert a horizontal rule. # Move the cursor to just below the horizontal rule line. # Hit the enter key. # The cursor jumps to the top of the page, inserts a row, and changes the text formatting to "paragraph". However, if you do the following, the behavior is as expected: # Position the cursor in a row underneath the heading. # Insert a horizontal rule. # Move the cursor to just below the horizontal rule line. # Hit the enter key and a new empty row is created as expected. If we compare the storage formats for the two scenarios described above, we see that the problem scenario looks like this:

Header 3

While the error free example looks like this with an extra paragraph tag line:

Header 3
fields.summary: Unable to insert new line underneath the Horizontal rule

fields.description:
I am having a hard time tracking what plugins are installed for what purpose, who requested it to be installed, etc.  It would be fantastic if there was a comment field for every plugin on the plugin management page for user-installed plugins.  

I would like this feature across all server applications (confluence, jira, bitbucket, etc)

Thanks
Tom

fields.summary: Content report table macro throwing ora-01795 error

fields.description:
The process to [rebuild the CONFANCESTORS table|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/rebuilding-the-ancestor-table-153948.html] operates in batches, but it does not write those batches to the database as it progresses. It writes them all at once at the end of the job.

This, when combined with slowness (eg caused by CONFSERVER-53054) can cause the process to be interrupted by a restart etc, which leaves the table completely empty, and no inherited permissions are applied.

NB: Even after logging {{Ancestors persisted to database in 507875 ms}}, the table is still at 0.
fields.summary: Rebuild of the CONFANCESTORS table does not write to the database in batches

fields.description:
Post space import as part of the Brikit Theme Press add on configuration, a full rebuild of the ancestors table occurs. This process is dramatically slower when Confluence Questions is installed - 2 hours+, vs 10m. This can lead to the thread being interrupted and the ancestors table being left completely empty, which causes permission issues.

h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Install CQ
 # Create some content, restrict a parent page, but do not restrict the children
 -- Confirm that the child pages inherit the restrictions from the parent
 -- Run select count\(*\) from CONFANCESTORS; and confirm the count is > 0
 # Install Brikit Theme Press
 # Go to Configure Theme Press and click Install
 -- Run select count\(*\) from CONFANCESTORS; and confirm the count is 0
 -- Test the child pages and confirm they are no longer restricted (NB: the parent page will still be restricted, but the children will not)
 # Run some thread dumps and confirm that the process is still running.

The issue seems to be in this section of the code path:
{code}

at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.questions.edgeindex.custom.QuestionsEdgeIndexBuilder.rebuild(QuestionsEdgeIndexBuilder.java:41)
at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.questions.internal.listeners.ImportFinishedListener.onImportFinishedEvent(ImportFinishedListener.java:25)
{code}

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When attempting to use certain unicode characters (🐛🐜🐝🐞) the page fails to save and displays an error message.

h3. Environment
* MySQL
** Confirmed on both 5.6 and 5.7
* Oracle
** Confirmed on 12c
* MS SQL Server
** Confirmed on SQL Server 2014

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new page
# Paste these unicode characters: 🐛🐜🐝🐞
# Save

h3. Expected Results
The page saves and displays the characters as expected.

h3. Actual Results
One of two results will happen:
* The page will fail to save and the below error is shown in the UI:
{noformat}Unable to communicate with server. Saving is not possible at the moment{noformat} 
* The page will save but unicode characters will be displayed as ?????

h3. Notes
* This does not affect PostgreSQL
* Tested with character encoding parameter in JDBC URL and it still has the same behavior.
* The unicode characters that cause this behavior are not limited to the ones in this report, these are simply confirmed and testable.

h3. Workaround
* Migrate to PostgreSQL
fields.summary: Some unicode characters prevent creating/editing pages using the Confluence Collaborative Editor

The yellow admin banner remains in a specific language no matter what the language settings are in the General Configuration, the browser and the user profile.

 # Set browser language to German from another language

h3. Expected Results

Everything on the instance would be in German.
h3. Actual Results

The banner is in English.
h3. Notes

Tried on two support engineer test instances. Please see screen shots for profile, global and browser language settings.

Some customers have had the banner appear in the correct language after restarting Confluence:
 [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Confluence-questions/Yellow-Administration-Banner-in-Confluence-Language-is-not/qaq-p/615318]

There seems to be something that doesn't refresh the Confluence language, even when logging out or clearing the browser cookies. It seems that the banner language is set by the first language that it sees and sticks to that language regardless of the header

h3. Problem Definition
It is cumbersome to work with sections in Confluence, especially if you wish to move an entire section from one place on a page to another, or better yet, from one page to another. Currently, only copy & paste is possible to move a section.

fields.description:
The Word importer does not escape wiki-markup-like characters within tables leading to a dissimilar export artifact in Confluence. 
h1. Reproduction procedure:
 * install Confluence 6.0.5 / 6.2.3
 * import [^Test-page.docx]
 * the import result will be equal to the left side of 
 !word-import-problem.png|thumbnail!

Let's look at the problems more closely (see: !word-import-problem.png|thumbnail! ):
 * 1. a bold Text starting with http will be transferred to a link with * at the beginning and at the end
 * 2. the commands text will be c ommands
 * 3. the code area with square brackets will be transferred to a corrupt unmigrated-wiki-markup macro
 * 4. the command with pipe will be transferred to two columns and the *pipe symbol has been removed*
 * 5. the carriage returns has been removed
 * 6. the Oracle command line printout will be transferred to a unsorted list.

h1. Workaround
h2. 1. Workaround - Character replacement

Search and replace all wiki-markup-like characters within the word file with the html code of the character.
 e.g (see [https://dev.w3.org/html5/html-author/charref] for the full html code list)
|character|html code|
|#|& # 35 ;|
|-|& # 8722 ;|
|[|& # 91 ;|
|]|& # 93 ;|
|pipe symbol|& # 124 ;|
|*|& # 42 ;|

The changed word file ( [^Test-page-workaround-html-code.docx] ) can be handled by the word importer

!word-import-workaround-html-code.png|thumbnail!
 (See https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-41626 and https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-41138 for carriage returns problem)

h2. 2. Workaround - Change the structure or fix the problems afterwards

The workaround is based on recommendations by getsupport.atlassian.com:
 ".. workaround is to change the structure of Office document to align with the limitation of Office Connector." and/or ".. edit or reconstruct the essential information in Editor after Word file imported .."
 see: [^Test-page-workaround-recommendation-atlassian-support.docx] and [https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/office-connector-limitations-and-known-issues-170492994.html]
fields.summary: Word importer does not escape wiki-markup-like characters within tables

fields.description:
h3. Description
When the user adding a two dimensional filter from the default JIRA issue filter macro (*+* >> JIRA issue/Filter >> JIRA Chart >> Two dimensional) the *Total Unique issues* will redirect the user to JIRA and show the following error message.
{code}
Invalid filter id. Filter id must be a number.
{code}

*Steps to reproduce*
# Create application link between JIRA and Confluence.
# Create a new page in confluence
# Add the two dimensional filter from (*+* >> JIRA issue/Filter >> JIRA Chart >> Two dimensional)
# Use a simple JQL such as below
{code}
project = "Testing Project 2" AND assignee = admin AND status != Closed
{code}
# Save the page
# Clicks the total of the *Total Unique Issues*, it would then redirect you to the URL - {{<JiraBaseURL>/issues/?filter=null}}.
(i) The filter ID constructed by the macro ({{null}}) is not correct here and would then be translated by Jira as an invalid ID. For more details, you may refer to the video below
 [^Recording #22.mp4] 

h3. Workaround
Register JIRA Two Dimensional Gadget in Confluence and use the gadget instead of the default two dimensional macro.
fields.summary: Total Unique Issues for two dimensional filter from default JIRA issue macro is redirecting user to invalid filter id error.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Installer does not work with AWS instance connected to [EFS|http://docs.aws.amazon.com/efs/latest/ug/gs-step-two-create-efs-resources.html] for the home and install directories.

h3. Environment
* AWS
* Using EFS to host the home/install directories

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Setup an EC2 instance and connect it to an EFS instance: http://docs.aws.amazon.com/efs/latest/ug/getting-started.html
# Download the 6.3.1 linux installer: https://www.atlassian.com/software/confluence/downloads/binary/atlassian-confluence-6.3.1-x64.bin
# Ensure there is enough space in the home and install directories on the EFS instance
# Run the installer and set the home and install directories to point to the EFS

h3. Expected Results
The installer completes without issues

h3. Actual Results
The below error is thrown in the terminal:
{noformat}
INFO: Created system preferences directory in java.home.
Not enough disk space for target directory: /opt/atlassian/confluence
{noformat}

h5. Notes
Similar issue described here: https://github.com/gocd/gocd/issues/2797. This could have to do with the call that the installer uses to check the space left on the device. 

h3.Workaround
Install Confluence from archive ([Installing Confluence on Linux from Archive File|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/installing-confluence-on-linux-from-archive-file-255362363.html]), or point the installer to a local directory in the EC2 instance's file system, then copy the files over to the EFS instance and modify the {{confluence-init.properties}} to point to the new location if necessary.
fields.summary: Installer does not work with AWS instance using EFS

fields.description:
Currently, we're pushing as much of new software deployments to RHEL/CentOS 7. This morning when I came in, I found that our Confluence server's java process had exited. I was able to login and `systemctl restart confluence` to get it back online, but it would be helpful if Confluence's SysV-style init scripts were supplemented with systemd-aware service-management components. If Confluence were systemd-aware, then crashing of the main Java process likely could be made to auto-restart.

Yeah, we can construct our Confluence deployments to re-deploy on service-loss, but letting systemd handle simple cases such as this morning would be quicker than a re-deployment and make the question of clustering about scale rather than about availability.
fields.summary: Systemd Support

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When initiating a REST API call, Confluence returns the data in chunked packets contaning small payload. This generates lots of traffic on the network and if you don't have a proxy or a load balancer that can repackage those packets for optimization, you might end up with packets drop or packet retransmission.


h3. Environment
Confluence Server or Data Center


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Start Confluence
# Login to Confluence and go to Recently Viewed or Recently Worked On (these will trigger rest calls)
# You can also fire a rest call using curl
{code:borderStyle=solid}
curl -u admin:admin -X GET http://localhost:8090/confluence/rest/api/content/123456789 | python -mjson.tool
{code}

h3. Steps to Monitor the traffic
# Install Wireshark on your client machine
# Start Recording
# Run the curl or refresh the page
# Stop Recording
# Inspect the tcp dump 

You will notice the following:
REST Call Request
!tcp-dump1.png|thumbnail!

REST Call details
!tcp-dump2.png|thumbnail! 

REST Call Response
!tcp-dump3.png|thumbnail!


REST Call Response chunks
!tcp-dump4.png|thumbnail!


REST Cal Response chunks
!tcp-dump5.png|thumbnail!


h3. Expected Results
Confluence responds with an optimal number of packets.
number of packets = (data-in-bytes / max-payload) + 1 (if data-in-bytes % max-payload > 0)


h3. Actual Results
Confluence responds with chunked packets containing little payload which increases the traffic on the network



h3.Workaround
The only workaround is to have a load balancer or reverse proxy that supports network repackaging to optimize that traffic
fields.summary: REST API calls respond with a lot of chunked packets

fields.description:
When attempting to deploy Confluence to some AWS regions Synchrony will not start properly because of AWS API using the wrong endpoint. The effected regions are:
 * US East (Ohio) - us-east-2
 * EU (London) - eu-west-2 _- See Note 1_
 * Asia Pacific (Mumbai) - ap-south-1 _- See Note 1_
 * Asia Pacific (Seoul) - ap-northeast-2 _- See Note 1_
 * Canada (Central) - ca-central-1 _- See Note 1_

Note 1: presently does not support EFS which is required to deploy on AWS using the Atlassian CloudFormation template
h3. Workaround

a. Use a different region to deploy Confluence

or

b. Do not deploy Synchrony and disable Collaborative Editing in Confluence
fields.summary: Synchrony could not start on some AWS regions (e.g. Ohio)

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
The fix shipped in 6.5.1 added [Restore Passwords To Recover Admin User Rights|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/restore-passwords-to-recover-admin-user-rights-158390.html].
This method can be used to recover an administrator account in cases like this and other cases. The documentation [Migrate from Confluence Cloud to Server|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/migrate-from-confluence-cloud-to-server-298979321.html] has also been updated.
{panel}
h2. Summary

Backup taken from Cloud doesn't allow users to login after import in Server.

Credentials *sysadmin* username/password as mentioned on [Migrate from Confluence Cloud to Server - Atlassian Documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/migrate-from-confluence-cloud-to-server-298979321.html] don't work.
h2. Environment
 * Confluence Cloud

h2. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Confluence Cloud export
 # Install latest Confluence Server
 # On the set up page, use the Cloud XML export to import a full site
 # Log in as *sysadmin*/*sysadmin*

h2. Expected Results

*sysadmin* user is able to login using password *sysadmin*
h2. Actual Results

*sysadmin* user is not able to login.
h2. Notes

The export doesn't contain the passwords for any of the users.

The *sysadmin* account is not fully created. There is no entry for *sysadmin* in {{cwd_user}} table and no {{cwd_membership}} table entries, but there is a *sysadmin* entry in the {{user_mapping}} table.
h2. Workaround

See
 * [Restoring Passwords To Recover Admin User Rights|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/restore-passwords-to-recover-admin-user-rights-158390.html]

To add an *admin* user to the database with password *admin*
 # Shutdown Confluence
 # Run this SQL insert to create the *admin* user with password *admin*
{code:sql}
insert into cwd_user(id, user_name, lower_user_name, active, created_date, updated_date, first_name, lower_first_name, last_name, lower_last_name, display_name, lower_display_name, email_address, lower_email_address, directory_id, credential) values (1212121, 'admin', 'admin', 'T', '2009-11-26 17:42:08', '2017-11-26 17:42:08', 'System', 'system', 'Administrator', 'administrator', 'System Administrator', 'system administrator', 'admin@example.com', 'admin@example.com', (select id from cwd_directory where directory_name='Confluence Internal Directory'), 'x61Ey612Kl2gpFL56FT9weDnpSo4AV8j8+qx2AuTHdRyY036xxzTTrw10Wq3+4qQyB+XURPWx1ONxp3Y3pB37A==');
insert into user_mapping values ('2c9681954172cf560000000000000001', 'admin', 'admin');
{code}

 # Add the *admin* user to the *confluence-users* and *confluence-administrators* groups
{code:sql}
insert into cwd_membership (id, parent_id, child_user_id) values (888888, (select id from cwd_group where group_name='confluence-users' and directory_id=(select id from cwd_directory where directory_name='Confluence Internal Directory')), 1212121);
insert into cwd_membership (id, parent_id, child_user_id) values (999999, (select id from cwd_group where group_name='confluence-administrators' and directory_id=(select id from cwd_directory where directory_name='Confluence Internal Directory')), 1212121);
{code}

 # Restart Confluence
 # Log in as user *admin* with password *admin*
fields.summary: Cloud to Server export users can't log in

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Task Report macro will show duplicated tasks if:
# There are duplicated users across multiple user directories
# The report is sorted by Assignee

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have a user with the username "admin" in Confluence Internal Directory
# Create a page, add task list and add "admin" to the task
# Add a "Task Report" on the same page. Save the page. It should look like this:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
# Connect to an LDAP that contains a user with the username "admin" as well.
# Go to the page with the Task Report, sort the list based on Assignee

h3. Expected Results
There is only 1 task appear on the report

h3. Actual Results
Duplicated task appears for that user
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
If we add another user directory that contains a user with the same username, "admin", the report will now show 3 tasks.

h3. Workarounds
Some users have reported that by changing the sort order to something else for the macro (such as 'Due date' instead of 'Assignee') will remove the duplicated tasks in the list.
fields.summary: Task Report macro will show duplicated tasks if there are duplicated users across user directory

fields.description:
Our team has a confluence space where the different roles inside the team interact.

For that we have an engineering page with meeting minutes for an engineering weekly.

Now we have more meetings that don't belong to engineering, but something different, like team meetings or other sync meetings.

If I add a page for meeting minutes with the usual "Create meeting notes" button using the usual meeting notes blueprint, all meeting minutes will get the keyword meeting-notes and will appear in the usual meeting notes list (blueprint) area.

Now I want to have 3 distinct kinds of meeting notes: engineering, team and sync.

It would be great if one could specify an additional keyword, e.g. when using the create-button and specify a keyword to match when listing meeting notes.

Alternative approach would be to add a filter to meeting notes list, like in the page-properties-report-macro, where one can specify: subpages of this page only. I can't use the specified macro instead because meeting notes don't appear there.
fields.summary: Possibility to have multiple distinct meeting-notes in one space.

fields.description:
h3. Step to reproduce the issue
# Create new space and a new question within that space.
# Answer that question and pick up the answer URL.
# Create a new page and parse the link into the editor

h3. Expected behaviour
The answer link should be correctly converted to a URL link with the question name and link to the answer, for example:
{{<Confluence Base URL>/display/<Space key>/questions/1540119/answers/1540121}}

h3. Current behaviour 
The line is converted to {{/questions/1540119/answers/1540121}} which mapped to a page creation link as it is considered as an unknown page.

h3. Workaround solution
After parsing the link, use Ctrl + Z to undo the conversion and the right link will be pickup by the Editor.

(!) The issue is only reproducible with the question linked to space, the answer link is working correctly with the question has not space key.
fields.summary: Confluence editor link convertor was not working for the CQS answers link within a space

fields.description:
h2. Problem summary When a user is renamed, one expects that all references to the old username to be updated to the new username. The workbox notification tray in the upper right of Confluence does not appear to be updated, and still references the old username. Clicking the link leads to an invalid profile page for a username that no longer exists. h2. Steps to reproduce # On a Confluence page, add a comment mentioning a user # Using the admin account, re-name the mentioned user (e.g., to user2) # In a separate browsing session, log in as the mentioned user. There should be a notification in the workbox tray from the mention. h2. Expected behavior The workbox notification should have updated the user reference so that it is now showing user2 h2. Actual behavior The workbox notification is still showing the original username. Clicking it will point to the user profile page for the username that no longer exists, resulting in a page not found error. The screenshot below demonstrates the stale username behavior in both the workbox notification tray as well as the link it is generating on mouse hover. !workbox_stale_username.png|thumbnail! h2. Additional notes It appears that these in-app notifications are stored in the table "AO_9412A1_AONOTIFICATION". The text is stored in the "DESCRIPTION" column, e.g.: {code}

hi myuser

{code} A comparison of the database before and after the rename shows that these entries are simply not being modified at all following a rename.
fields.summary: Usernames and links in notification tray (workbox) are not updated when a user is renamed

fields.description:
It would be really useful to be able to have the Collaborative Editor follow around a specified editor's cursor, to avoid the "i've jumped down a few paragraphs" dialog you may be having over the phone/etc.

A possible approach:
 * Clicking on a person's avatar should jump down to their current cursor position
(and probably remove your own cursor from the editing area)
 * Then until you make a text-selection or mouseclick/etc, it should continue to follow that user's cursor (perhaps highlighting their avatar while this 'follow' mode is on)

Ideally you would also try to match their current scroll-position/viewport on all editor's screens. e.g. if the 'followed' editor is making changes near the 'top' of a table in their visible working area, then that same row should also be near the top of other editor's windows ... scaled to their respective viewport/window size. This would mean that discussions occurring in tandem (e.g. a telephone call) about the content edit have the same context as what the main editor's view is).
fields.summary: 'Follow me' and 'Find cursor' function for Collaborative Editing

fields.description:
h3. Summary

After creating a custom field(or renaming the field) in JIRA, the JIRA Issue macro won't enable the sorting for that custom field until Confluence is restarted.

{panel:borderStyle=dashed| borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
(!)  This will happen in case the Field is updated in JIRA, like creating one or updating its name. 
{panel}

h3. Environment
Tested with Confluence 6.2.3 and JIRA 7.3.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In JIRA, create a Custom Field.
# In Confluence, insert a JIRA issue macro and display the custom field that you created in the first step.
# Save the changes.

h3. Expected Results

Sorting will be available for that custom field

h3. Actual Results
Sorting won't be available for it, although default fields will be sortable. After *restarting* Confluence, the custom field will be "sortable" like the other ones.
 
h3. Notes
- Flushing the cache in Confluence won't resolve.
- Rebuilding the indexing of the content won't resolve.
- Clearing the browser's cookies won't resolve.
- *Sometimes, a few hours later, the field is sortable. Probably an internal job is executed in the background(unknown job)*.

h3.Update 2018
With the release of Confluence 6.8.0, restarting Confluence will not work, however, clearing the plugins cache(and flushing the cache on the *Cache Management* page) may resolve the problem.

h3.Workaround
Only restarting Confluence.
fields.summary: Custom Field(new or renamed field) in JIRA Issue Macro is not "sortable" until Confluence is restarted.

fields.description:
Sometimes large space exports can cause problems:
* Disk space on the server
* Performance issues
* Locked threads causing outages

Some suggestions to avoid this and improve the experience overall:
# Warn users of what the size of the space is and how long it might take before beginning
# Provide a way to actually cancel the export once it has started, which will actually stop the thread in the background (currently the thread will complete regardless of whether the user abandons the request).

fields.description:
h3. Problem statement
When Confluence is upgraded, a pre and post-upgrade recovery file are generated by default and can sometimes result in an OOM error or a long upgrade pause to occur. This is not ideal for large instances and administrators have to disable this by adding the following argument in the {{setenv}} file.
{code}-Dconfluence.upgrade.recovery.file.enabled=false{code}

h3. Suggestion
As the pre and post-upgrade recovery files can't be used to restore an instance's data, it serves little to no purpose to our users. It is also troublesome for administrators to constantly add this parameter in with every upgrade attempt (especially when the upgrade is performed many times in case of any upgrade failures).

Therefore, it would be great if the parameter below could be added to the Java options by default or if the recovery files are simply not generated at all.
{code}-Dconfluence.upgrade.recovery.file.enabled=false{code}
fields.summary: Disable the generation of the Confluence upgrade recovery file by default

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The links in Team Calendars reminders emails point to a broken page. This applies to both links. One to direct to the calendar event and the other to "Turn off reminder".  The links direct to a page that contains a spinner, unformatted text, and buttons that don't work.  It's unclear what the page was supposed to do.

  !Screen Shot 2017-07-19 at 11.52.24.png|thumbnail!   !Screen Shot 2017-07-19 at 11.53.07.png|thumbnail!   !Screen Shot 2017-07-19 at 11.53.42.png|thumbnail!
h3. Environment
 * Confluence 6.2.3
 * Team Calendars 5.3.19

h3. Steps to Reproduce

*Environment setup*
 # In Confluence, add a valid mail server so that calendar event reminders and notifications can be emailed
 # Install Team Calendars Add-on
 # Create a Team Calendar

*Steps to reproduce issue*
 # Create a team calendar event
 # Add a user to the event in *Who*
 # Add a reminder *5 minutes* before
 # Hit *OK* to save the event (save this with enough time before the event reminder should be sent)
 # Wait for the reminder email to be sent out
 # When the *Team Calendars Reminders* email is received
 # Try both links:
 ** Turn off reminders
 ** Link to the calendar event (event name)
 ** The link will direct to a page that.... looks all kinds of broken and not functional

h3. Expected Results

The links in the reminder email should take the user to the respective pages to view the event and/or turn off the reminders
h3. Actual Results

See screenshot for the page the links direct to. The page is not functional. The spinner keeps spinning. The buttons don't work.
h3. Workaround

The user can login and navigate to the event manually to view the event details but they can't "turn off reminders". 
 This documentation says there should be a "Stop reminding me" link in the email, but that doesn't exist. 
 See: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/teamcal/reminders-693899708.html] ("You can also opt-out of reminder emails for an event type by clicking the 'Stop reminding me' link in the reminder email.")
fields.summary: Team Calendars reminder email contains links to broken page, cannot Turn off reminders

fields.description:
*+Scenario:+*

The /\{INSTALLATION-DIR}/conf/setenv.sh file has many options which would be very valuable to make symbols such that a quick sed command could modify these configurations.

in v6.3.1 for instance I want to automate the installation such that it uses 4096MB of RAM for the Java implementation instead of 1024.

*+Expected behaviour:+*

Modify a symbol at the top of the file beginning with a specific string to use a new value:
 *JAVA_XMX=4096m ; JAVA_XMS=1024m*

*+Actual behaviour:+*

In v6.3.1 I would need to modify _*line 69*_ to be *CATALINA_OPTS="-Xms2048m -Xmx4096 -XX:+UseG1GC $\{CATALINA_OPTS}"*
 This can be done with a sed command, but this file format has changed so many times that if I make a script there is no way to know if it will be relevant in the next version without verification.
 *sed -i 's/Xms1024m/Xms2048m/' /tmp/sed/setenv.sh && sed -i 's/Xmx1024m/Xmx2048m/' /ATLASSIAN-INSTALL/bin/setenv.sh*

Suggestion:
 *ENV JAVA_XMS 1024m*
 *ENV JAVA_XMX 1024m*

*LINE 69: CATALINA_OPTS="-Xms\{JAVA_XMS} -Xmx\{JAVA_XMX} -XX:+UseG1GC $\{CATALINA_OPTS}"*
fields.summary: As an admin I would like a quick way to automate configuration of the server

fields.description:
When Team Calendars sends out a mail notification about an event, the image files that represent the participants' avatars come without extension. This can be a problem when the Mail Server or Mail Gateway considers the attachment as a potential risk and blocks the email.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Install Team Calendars 5.3.19 in a Confluence instance
2. Configure a valid Mail Server
3. Create two users:
* user1, no profile picture, valid email
* user2, upload a profile picture, valid email

4. Log in as user1.
5. Create an event and add both users as participants ("Who" field)
6. Check the email configured in user2

h3. Results

The generic profile picture linked to user1 comes with .png extension. The uploaded profile picture linked to user2 comes without extension.

There's no workaround since we cannot set the email format as Plain Text (https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-23907) nor delete the existing user profile pictures once they have been uploaded (https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-39313).
fields.summary: Mail notifications sent by Team Calendars come with profile pics without extension
